meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of foreigners or foreign countries.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant had a xenic atmosphere with decorations from various countries.
meanings.sent2: She had a xenic taste in music, always listening to songs from different cultures.
meanings.sent3: His xenic fashion sense stood out in the small town.
meanings.sent4: The xenic blend of spices in the dish transported her to distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The xenic language on the street signs made her feel like a world traveler.

meanings.definition: Showing or characterized by an interest in or openness to foreign cultures.
meanings.sent1: Their xenic art collection displayed pieces from around the globe.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his xenic approach to trying new foods.
meanings.sent3: The xenic festival celebrated diversity and unity.
meanings.sent4: Her xenic mindset allowed her to appreciate different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The xenic music festival brought together people of all backgrounds.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or denoting a type of gene transfer between different species.
meanings.sent1: The xenic gene transfer experiment aimed to create new hybrids.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the xenic gene transfer process in detail.
meanings.sent3: The xenic genetic modification resulted in unexpected traits.
meanings.sent4: The xenic gene editing technique revolutionized biotechnology.
meanings.sent5: The xenic DNA combination led to remarkable scientific breakthroughs.
